title: Implicit function: Find and apply deriv., MVT

content.description:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Consider the curve given by the equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGOmaiaacI cacaWG4bGaeyOeI0IaamyEaiaacMcacqGH9aqpcaaIZaGaey4kaSIa ci4yaiaac+gacaGGZbGaamyEaaaa@4169@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. For all points on the curve, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>2</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaaWdaeaapeGaaG4maaaacqGHKjYOdaWc aaWdaeaapeGaamizaiaadMhaa8aabaWdbiaadsgacaWG4baaaiabgs MiJkaaikdaaaa@401A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: (b) For <math><semantics><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>y</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacqGHsisldaWcaaWdaeaapeGaeqiWdahapaqaa8qacaaIYaaaaiab gYda8iaadMhacqGH8aapdaWcaaWdaeaapeGaeqiWdahapaqaa8qaca aIYaaaaaaa@3F93@</annotation></semantics></math>, there is a point P on the curve through which the line tangent to the curve has slope 1. Find the coordinates of the point P.

(c) Determine the concavity of the curve at points for which <math><semantics><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>y</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacqGHsisldaWcaaWdaeaapeGaeqiWdahapaqaa8qacaaIYaaaaiab gYda8iaadMhacqGH8aapdaWcaaWdaeaapeGaeqiWdahapaqaa8qaca aIYaaaaaaa@3F93@</annotation></semantics></math>. Give a reason for your answer.

(d) Let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyEaiabg2 da9iaadAgacaGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcaaaa@3B3B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> be a function, defined implicitly by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGOmaiaacI cacaWG4bGaeyOeI0IaamyEaiaacMcacqGH9aqpcaaIZaGaey4kaSIa ci4yaiaac+gacaGGZbGaamyEaaaa@4169@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, that is continuous on the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>2.1</mn> </mrow> <mo>]</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaamWaaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdacaGGSaGaaeiiaiaaikdacaGGUaGaaGymaaWd aiaawUfacaGLDbaaaaa@3C4F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and differentiable on the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>2.1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaeWaaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdacaGGSaGaaeiiaiaaikdacaGGUaGaaGymaaWd aiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@3BE6@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Use the Mean Value Theorem on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>2.1</mn> </mrow> <mo>]</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaamWaaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdacaGGSaGaaeiiaiaaikdacaGGUaGaaGymaaWd aiaawUfacaGLDbaaaaa@3C4F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> to show that <math><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>≤</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2.1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaiaaiwdaaaGaeyiz ImQaamOzaiaacIcacaaIYaGaaiOlaiaaigdacaGGPaGaeyOeI0Iaam OzaiaacIcacaaIYaGaaiykaiabgsMiJoaalaaapaqaa8qacaaIXaaa paqaa8qacaaI1aaaaaaa@4621@</annotation></semantics></math>.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
